intro: Rhynchelythrum rupicola, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue or lilac, with five petals and a distinctive spur. Rhynchelythrum rupicola is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in open habitats such as cliffs and slopes.
